098/**
099 * BucketCache uses {@link BucketAllocator} to allocate/free blocks, and uses BucketCache#ramCache
100 * and BucketCache#backingMap in order to determine if a given element is in the cache. The bucket
101 * cache can use off-heap memory {@link ByteBufferIOEngine} or mmap
102 * {@link ExclusiveMemoryMmapIOEngine} or pmem {@link SharedMemoryMmapIOEngine} or local files
103 * {@link FileIOEngine} to store/read the block data.
104 * <p>
105 * Eviction is via a similar algorithm as used in
106 * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.LruBlockCache}
107 * <p>
108 * BucketCache can be used as mainly a block cache (see
109 * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.CombinedBlockCache}), combined with a BlockCache to
110 * decrease CMS GC and heap fragmentation.
111 * <p>
112 * It also can be used as a secondary cache (e.g. using a file on ssd/fusionio to store blocks) to
113 * enlarge cache space via a victim cache.
114 */
115@InterfaceAudience.Private
116public class BucketCache implements BlockCache, HeapSize {
117  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BucketCache.class);
118
119  /** Priority buckets config */
120  static final String SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.single.factor";
121  static final String MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.multi.factor";
122  static final String MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.memory.factor";
123  static final String EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.extrafreefactor";
124  static final String ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.acceptfactor";
125  static final String MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.minfactor";
126  static final String BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE =
127    "hbase.bucketcache.persistence.chunksize";
128
129  /** Use strong reference for offsetLock or not */
130  private static final String STRONG_REF_KEY = "hbase.bucketcache.offsetlock.usestrongref";
131  private static final boolean STRONG_REF_DEFAULT = false;
132
133  /** Priority buckets */
134  static final float DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR = 0.25f;
135  static final float DEFAULT_MULTI_FACTOR = 0.50f;
136  static final float DEFAULT_MEMORY_FACTOR = 0.25f;
137  static final float DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR = 0.85f;
138
139  private static final float DEFAULT_EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR = 0.10f;
140  private static final float DEFAULT_ACCEPT_FACTOR = 0.95f;
141
142  // Number of blocks to clear for each of the bucket size that is full
143  private static final int DEFAULT_FREE_ENTIRE_BLOCK_FACTOR = 2;
144
145  /** Statistics thread */
146  private static final int statThreadPeriod = 5 * 60;
147
148  final static int DEFAULT_WRITER_THREADS = 3;
149  final static int DEFAULT_WRITER_QUEUE_ITEMS = 64;
150
151  final static long DEFAULT_BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE = 10000000;
152
153  // Store/read block data
154  transient final IOEngine ioEngine;
155
156  // Store the block in this map before writing it to cache
157  transient final RAMCache ramCache;
158
159  // In this map, store the block's meta data like offset, length
160  transient Map<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> backingMap;
161
162  private AtomicBoolean backingMapValidated = new AtomicBoolean(false);
163
164  /**
165   * Map of hFile -> Region -> File size. This map is used to track all files completed prefetch,
166   * together with the region those belong to and the total cached size for the
167   * region.TestBlockEvictionOnRegionMovement
168   */
169  final Map<String, Pair<String, Long>> fullyCachedFiles = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
170  /**
171   * Map of region -> total size of the region prefetched on this region server. This is the total
172   * size of hFiles for this region prefetched on this region server
173   */
174  final Map<String, Long> regionCachedSize = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
175
176  private BucketCachePersister cachePersister;
177
178  /**
179   * Flag if the cache is enabled or not... We shut it off if there are IO errors for some time, so
180   * that Bucket IO exceptions/errors don't bring down the HBase server.
181   */
182  private volatile boolean cacheEnabled;
183
184  /**
185   * A list of writer queues. We have a queue per {@link WriterThread} we have running. In other
186   * words, the work adding blocks to the BucketCache is divided up amongst the running
187   * WriterThreads. Its done by taking hash of the cache key modulo queue count. WriterThread when
188   * it runs takes whatever has been recently added and 'drains' the entries to the BucketCache. It
189   * then updates the ramCache and backingMap accordingly.
190   */
191  transient final ArrayList<BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry>> writerQueues = new ArrayList<>();
192  transient final WriterThread[] writerThreads;
193
194  /** Volatile boolean to track if free space is in process or not */
195  private volatile boolean freeInProgress = false;
196  private transient final Lock freeSpaceLock = new ReentrantLock();
197
198  private final LongAdder realCacheSize = new LongAdder();
199  private final LongAdder heapSize = new LongAdder();
200  /** Current number of cached elements */
201  private final LongAdder blockNumber = new LongAdder();
202
203  /** Cache access count (sequential ID) */
204  private final AtomicLong accessCount = new AtomicLong();
205
206  private static final int DEFAULT_CACHE_WAIT_TIME = 50;
207
208  private final BucketCacheStats cacheStats = new BucketCacheStats();
209  private final String persistencePath;
210  static AtomicBoolean isCacheInconsistent = new AtomicBoolean(false);
211  private final long cacheCapacity;
212  /** Approximate block size */
213  private final long blockSize;
214
215  /** Duration of IO errors tolerated before we disable cache, 1 min as default */
216  private final int ioErrorsTolerationDuration;
217  // 1 min
218  public static final int DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION = 60 * 1000;
219
220  // Start time of first IO error when reading or writing IO Engine, it will be
221  // reset after a successful read/write.
222  private volatile long ioErrorStartTime = -1;
223
224  private Configuration conf;
225
226  /**
227   * A ReentrantReadWriteLock to lock on a particular block identified by offset. The purpose of
228   * this is to avoid freeing the block which is being read.
229   * <p>
230   */
231  transient final IdReadWriteLock<Long> offsetLock;
232
233  NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey> blocksByHFile = new ConcurrentSkipListSet<>(
234    Comparator.comparing(BlockCacheKey::getHfileName).thenComparingLong(BlockCacheKey::getOffset));
235
236  /** Statistics thread schedule pool (for heavy debugging, could remove) */
237  private transient final ScheduledExecutorService scheduleThreadPool =
238    Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(1,
239      new ThreadFactoryBuilder().setNameFormat("BucketCacheStatsExecutor").setDaemon(true).build());
240
241  // Allocate or free space for the block
242  private transient BucketAllocator bucketAllocator;
243
244  /** Acceptable size of cache (no evictions if size < acceptable) */
245  private float acceptableFactor;
246
247  /** Minimum threshold of cache (when evicting, evict until size < min) */
248  private float minFactor;
249
250  /**
251   * Free this floating point factor of extra blocks when evicting. For example free the number of
252   * blocks requested * (1 + extraFreeFactor)
253   */
254  private float extraFreeFactor;
255
256  /** Single access bucket size */
257  private float singleFactor;
258
259  /** Multiple access bucket size */
260  private float multiFactor;
261
262  /** In-memory bucket size */
263  private float memoryFactor;
264
265  private long bucketcachePersistInterval;
266
267  private static final String FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM =
268    "hbase.bucketcache.persistent.file.integrity.check.algorithm";
269  private static final String DEFAULT_FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM = "MD5";
270
271  private static final String QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME =
272    "hbase.bucketcache.queue.addition.waittime";
273  private static final long DEFAULT_QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME = 0;
274  private long queueAdditionWaitTime;
275  /**
276   * Use {@link java.security.MessageDigest} class's encryption algorithms to check persistent file
277   * integrity, default algorithm is MD5
278   */
279  private String algorithm;
280
281  private long persistenceChunkSize;
282
283  /* Tracing failed Bucket Cache allocations. */
284  private long allocFailLogPrevTs; // time of previous log event for allocation failure.
285  private static final int ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD = 60000; // Default 1 minute.
286
287  public BucketCache(String ioEngineName, long capacity, int blockSize, int[] bucketSizes,
288    int writerThreadNum, int writerQLen, String persistencePath) throws IOException {
289    this(ioEngineName, capacity, blockSize, bucketSizes, writerThreadNum, writerQLen,
290      persistencePath, DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, HBaseConfiguration.create());
291  }
292
293  public BucketCache(String ioEngineName, long capacity, int blockSize, int[] bucketSizes,
294    int writerThreadNum, int writerQLen, String persistencePath, int ioErrorsTolerationDuration,
295    Configuration conf) throws IOException {
296    Preconditions.checkArgument(blockSize > 0,
297      "BucketCache capacity is set to " + blockSize + ", can not be less than 0");
298    boolean useStrongRef = conf.getBoolean(STRONG_REF_KEY, STRONG_REF_DEFAULT);
299    if (useStrongRef) {
300      this.offsetLock = new IdReadWriteLockStrongRef<>();
301    } else {
302      this.offsetLock = new IdReadWriteLockWithObjectPool<>(ReferenceType.SOFT);
303    }
304    this.conf = conf;
305    this.algorithm = conf.get(FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM, DEFAULT_FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM);
306    this.ioEngine = getIOEngineFromName(ioEngineName, capacity, persistencePath);
307    this.writerThreads = new WriterThread[writerThreadNum];
308    long blockNumCapacity = capacity / blockSize;
309    if (blockNumCapacity >= Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
310      // Enough for about 32TB of cache!
311      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cache capacity is too large, only support 32TB now");
312    }
313
314    this.acceptableFactor = conf.getFloat(ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_ACCEPT_FACTOR);
315    this.minFactor = conf.getFloat(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR);
316    this.extraFreeFactor = conf.getFloat(EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR);
317    this.singleFactor = conf.getFloat(SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR);
318    this.multiFactor = conf.getFloat(MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MULTI_FACTOR);
319    this.memoryFactor = conf.getFloat(MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MEMORY_FACTOR);
320    this.queueAdditionWaitTime =
321      conf.getLong(QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME, DEFAULT_QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME);
322    this.bucketcachePersistInterval = conf.getLong(BUCKETCACHE_PERSIST_INTERVAL_KEY, 1000);
323    this.persistenceChunkSize =
324      conf.getLong(BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE, DEFAULT_BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE);
325    if (this.persistenceChunkSize <= 0) {
326      persistenceChunkSize = DEFAULT_BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE;
327    }
328
329    sanityCheckConfigs();
330
331    LOG.info("Instantiating BucketCache with acceptableFactor: " + acceptableFactor
332      + ", minFactor: " + minFactor + ", extraFreeFactor: " + extraFreeFactor + ", singleFactor: "
333      + singleFactor + ", multiFactor: " + multiFactor + ", memoryFactor: " + memoryFactor
334      + ", useStrongRef: " + useStrongRef);
335
336    this.cacheCapacity = capacity;
337    this.persistencePath = persistencePath;
338    this.blockSize = blockSize;
339    this.ioErrorsTolerationDuration = ioErrorsTolerationDuration;
340
341    this.allocFailLogPrevTs = 0;
342
343    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i) {
344      writerQueues.add(new ArrayBlockingQueue<>(writerQLen));
345    }
346
347    assert writerQueues.size() == writerThreads.length;
348    this.ramCache = new RAMCache();
349
350    this.backingMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>((int) blockNumCapacity);
351
352    if (isCachePersistent()) {
353      if (ioEngine instanceof FileIOEngine) {
354        startBucketCachePersisterThread();
355      }
356      try {
357        retrieveFromFile(bucketSizes);
358      } catch (IOException ioex) {
359        LOG.error("Can't restore from file[{}] because of ", persistencePath, ioex);
360        backingMap.clear();
361        fullyCachedFiles.clear();
362        backingMapValidated.set(true);
363        bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(capacity, bucketSizes);
364        regionCachedSize.clear();
365      }
366    } else {
367      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(capacity, bucketSizes);
368    }
369    final String threadName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
370    this.cacheEnabled = true;
371    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i) {
372      writerThreads[i] = new WriterThread(writerQueues.get(i));
373      writerThreads[i].setName(threadName + "-BucketCacheWriter-" + i);
374      writerThreads[i].setDaemon(true);
375    }
376    startWriterThreads();
377
378    // Run the statistics thread periodically to print the cache statistics log
379    // TODO: Add means of turning this off. Bit obnoxious running thread just to make a log
380    // every five minutes.
381    this.scheduleThreadPool.scheduleAtFixedRate(new StatisticsThread(this), statThreadPeriod,
382      statThreadPeriod, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
383    LOG.info("Started bucket cache; ioengine=" + ioEngineName + ", capacity="
384      + StringUtils.byteDesc(capacity) + ", blockSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(blockSize)
385      + ", writerThreadNum=" + writerThreadNum + ", writerQLen=" + writerQLen + ", persistencePath="
386      + persistencePath + ", bucketAllocator=" + this.bucketAllocator.getClass().getName());
387  }
388
389  private void sanityCheckConfigs() {
390    Preconditions.checkArgument(acceptableFactor <= 1 && acceptableFactor >= 0,
391      ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
392    Preconditions.checkArgument(minFactor <= 1 && minFactor >= 0,
393      MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
394    Preconditions.checkArgument(minFactor <= acceptableFactor,
395      MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be <= " + ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME);
396    Preconditions.checkArgument(extraFreeFactor >= 0,
397      EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be greater than 0.0");
398    Preconditions.checkArgument(singleFactor <= 1 && singleFactor >= 0,
399      SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
400    Preconditions.checkArgument(multiFactor <= 1 && multiFactor >= 0,
401      MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
402    Preconditions.checkArgument(memoryFactor <= 1 && memoryFactor >= 0,
403      MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
404    Preconditions.checkArgument((singleFactor + multiFactor + memoryFactor) == 1,
405      SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + ", " + MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + ", and "
406        + MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " segments must add up to 1.0");
407  }
408
409  /**
410   * Called by the constructor to start the writer threads. Used by tests that need to override
411   * starting the threads.
412   */
413  protected void startWriterThreads() {
414    for (WriterThread thread : writerThreads) {
415      thread.start();
416    }
417  }
418
419  void startBucketCachePersisterThread() {
420    LOG.info("Starting BucketCachePersisterThread");
421    cachePersister = new BucketCachePersister(this, bucketcachePersistInterval);
422    cachePersister.setDaemon(true);
423    cachePersister.start();
424  }
425
426  boolean isCacheEnabled() {
427    return this.cacheEnabled;
428  }
429
430  @Override
431  public long getMaxSize() {
432    return this.cacheCapacity;
433  }
434
435  public String getIoEngine() {
436    return ioEngine.toString();
437  }
438
439  /**
440   * Get the IOEngine from the IO engine name
441   * @return the IOEngine
442   */
443  private IOEngine getIOEngineFromName(String ioEngineName, long capacity, String persistencePath)
444    throws IOException {
445    if (ioEngineName.startsWith("file:") || ioEngineName.startsWith("files:")) {
446      // In order to make the usage simple, we only need the prefix 'files:' in
447      // document whether one or multiple file(s), but also support 'file:' for
448      // the compatibility
449      String[] filePaths =
450        ioEngineName.substring(ioEngineName.indexOf(":") + 1).split(FileIOEngine.FILE_DELIMITER);
451      return new FileIOEngine(capacity, persistencePath != null, filePaths);
452    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("offheap")) {
453      return new ByteBufferIOEngine(capacity);
454    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("mmap:")) {
455      return new ExclusiveMemoryMmapIOEngine(ioEngineName.substring(5), capacity);
456    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("pmem:")) {
457      // This mode of bucket cache creates an IOEngine over a file on the persistent memory
458      // device. Since the persistent memory device has its own address space the contents
459      // mapped to this address space does not get swapped out like in the case of mmapping
460      // on to DRAM. Hence the cells created out of the hfile blocks in the pmem bucket cache
461      // can be directly referred to without having to copy them onheap. Once the RPC is done,
462      // the blocks can be returned back as in case of ByteBufferIOEngine.
463      return new SharedMemoryMmapIOEngine(ioEngineName.substring(5), capacity);
464    } else {
465      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
466        "Don't understand io engine name for cache- prefix with file:, files:, mmap: or offheap");
467    }
468  }
469
470  public boolean isCachePersistenceEnabled() {
471    return persistencePath != null;
472  }
473
474  /**
475   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
476   * @param cacheKey block's cache key
477   * @param buf      block buffer
478   */
479  @Override
480  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable buf) {
481    cacheBlock(cacheKey, buf, false);
482  }
483
484  /**
485   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
486   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
487   * @param cachedItem block buffer
488   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
489   */
490  @Override
491  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory) {
492    cacheBlockWithWait(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, false);
493  }
494
495  /**
496   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
497   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
498   * @param cachedItem block buffer
499   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
500   */
501  @Override
502  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory,
503    boolean waitWhenCache) {
504    cacheBlockWithWait(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, waitWhenCache && queueAdditionWaitTime > 0);
505  }
506
507  /**
508   * Cache the block to ramCache
509   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
510   * @param cachedItem block buffer
511   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
512   * @param wait       if true, blocking wait when queue is full
513   */
514  public void cacheBlockWithWait(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory,
515    boolean wait) {
516    if (cacheEnabled) {
517      if (backingMap.containsKey(cacheKey) || ramCache.containsKey(cacheKey)) {
518        if (shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(cacheKey, cachedItem)) {
519          BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
520          if (bucketEntry != null && bucketEntry.isRpcRef()) {
521            // avoid replace when there are RPC refs for the bucket entry in bucket cache
522            return;
523          }
524          cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, wait);
525        }
526      } else {
527        cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, wait);
528      }
529    }
530  }
531
532  protected boolean shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable newBlock) {
533    return BlockCacheUtil.shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(this, cacheKey, newBlock);
534  }
535
536  protected void cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem,
537    boolean inMemory, boolean wait) {
538    if (!cacheEnabled) {
539      return;
540    }
541    if (cacheKey.getBlockType() == null && cachedItem.getBlockType() != null) {
542      cacheKey.setBlockType(cachedItem.getBlockType());
543    }
544    LOG.trace("Caching key={}, item={}", cacheKey, cachedItem);
545    // Stuff the entry into the RAM cache so it can get drained to the persistent store
546    RAMQueueEntry re = new RAMQueueEntry(cacheKey, cachedItem, accessCount.incrementAndGet(),
547      inMemory, isCachePersistent() && ioEngine instanceof FileIOEngine);
548    /**
549     * Don't use ramCache.put(cacheKey, re) here. because there may be a existing entry with same
550     * key in ramCache, the heap size of bucket cache need to update if replacing entry from
551     * ramCache. But WriterThread will also remove entry from ramCache and update heap size, if
552     * using ramCache.put(), It's possible that the removed entry in WriterThread is not the correct
553     * one, then the heap size will mess up (HBASE-20789)
554     */
555    if (ramCache.putIfAbsent(cacheKey, re) != null) {
556      return;
557    }
558    int queueNum = (cacheKey.hashCode() & 0x7FFFFFFF) % writerQueues.size();
559    BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> bq = writerQueues.get(queueNum);
560    boolean successfulAddition = false;
561    if (wait) {
562      try {
563        successfulAddition = bq.offer(re, queueAdditionWaitTime, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
564      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
565        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
566      }
567    } else {
568      successfulAddition = bq.offer(re);
569    }
570    if (!successfulAddition) {
571      ramCache.remove(cacheKey);
572      cacheStats.failInsert();
573    } else {
574      this.blockNumber.increment();
575      this.heapSize.add(cachedItem.heapSize());
576    }
577  }
578
579  /**
580   * If the passed cache key relates to a reference (&lt;hfile&gt;.&lt;parentEncRegion&gt;), this
581   * method looks for the block from the referred file, in the cache. If present in the cache, the
582   * block for the referred file is returned, otherwise, this method returns null. It will also
583   * return null if the passed cache key doesn't relate to a reference.
584   * @param key the BlockCacheKey instance to look for in the cache.
585   * @return the cached block from the referred file, null if there's no such block in the cache or
586   *         the passed key doesn't relate to a reference.
587   */
588  public BucketEntry getBlockForReference(BlockCacheKey key) {
589    BucketEntry foundEntry = null;
590    String referredFileName = null;
591    if (StoreFileInfo.isReference(key.getHfileName())) {
592      referredFileName = StoreFileInfo.getReferredToRegionAndFile(key.getHfileName()).getSecond();
593    }
594    if (referredFileName != null) {
595      BlockCacheKey convertedCacheKey = new BlockCacheKey(referredFileName, key.getOffset());
596      foundEntry = backingMap.get(convertedCacheKey);
597      LOG.debug("Got a link/ref: {}. Related cacheKey: {}. Found entry: {}", key.getHfileName(),
598        convertedCacheKey, foundEntry);
599    }
600    return foundEntry;
601  }
602
603  /**
604   * Get the buffer of the block with the specified key.
605   * @param key                block's cache key
606   * @param caching            true if the caller caches blocks on cache misses
607   * @param repeat             Whether this is a repeat lookup for the same block
608   * @param updateCacheMetrics Whether we should update cache metrics or not
609   * @return buffer of specified cache key, or null if not in cache
610   */
611  @Override
612  public Cacheable getBlock(BlockCacheKey key, boolean caching, boolean repeat,
613    boolean updateCacheMetrics) {
614    if (!cacheEnabled) {
615      return null;
616    }
617    RAMQueueEntry re = ramCache.get(key);
618    if (re != null) {
619      if (updateCacheMetrics) {
620        cacheStats.hit(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
621      }
622      re.access(accessCount.incrementAndGet());
623      return re.getData();
624    }
625    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(key);
626    if (bucketEntry == null) {
627      bucketEntry = getBlockForReference(key);
628    }
629    if (bucketEntry != null) {
630      long start = System.nanoTime();
631      ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = offsetLock.getLock(bucketEntry.offset());
632      try {
633        lock.readLock().lock();
634        // We can not read here even if backingMap does contain the given key because its offset
635        // maybe changed. If we lock BlockCacheKey instead of offset, then we can only check
636        // existence here.
637        if (
638          bucketEntry.equals(backingMap.get(key)) || bucketEntry.equals(getBlockForReference(key))
639        ) {
640          // Read the block from IOEngine based on the bucketEntry's offset and length, NOTICE: the
641          // block will use the refCnt of bucketEntry, which means if two HFileBlock mapping to
642          // the same BucketEntry, then all of the three will share the same refCnt.
643          Cacheable cachedBlock = ioEngine.read(bucketEntry);
644          if (ioEngine.usesSharedMemory()) {
645            // If IOEngine use shared memory, cachedBlock and BucketEntry will share the
646            // same RefCnt, do retain here, in order to count the number of RPC references
647            cachedBlock.retain();
648          }
649          // Update the cache statistics.
650          if (updateCacheMetrics) {
651            cacheStats.hit(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
652            cacheStats.ioHit(System.nanoTime() - start);
653          }
654          bucketEntry.access(accessCount.incrementAndGet());
655          if (this.ioErrorStartTime > 0) {
656            ioErrorStartTime = -1;
657          }
658          return cachedBlock;
659        }
660      } catch (HBaseIOException hioex) {
661        // When using file io engine persistent cache,
662        // the cache map state might differ from the actual cache. If we reach this block,
663        // we should remove the cache key entry from the backing map
664        backingMap.remove(key);
665        fullyCachedFiles.remove(key.getHfileName());
666        LOG.debug("Failed to fetch block for cache key: {}.", key, hioex);
667      } catch (IOException ioex) {
668        LOG.error("Failed reading block " + key + " from bucket cache", ioex);
669        checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
670      } finally {
671        lock.readLock().unlock();
672      }
673    }
674    if (!repeat && updateCacheMetrics) {
675      cacheStats.miss(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
676    }
677    return null;
678  }
679
680  /**
681   * This method is invoked after the bucketEntry is removed from {@link BucketCache#backingMap}
682   */
683  void blockEvicted(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry, boolean decrementBlockNumber,
684    boolean evictedByEvictionProcess) {
685    bucketEntry.markAsEvicted();
686    blocksByHFile.remove(cacheKey);
687    if (decrementBlockNumber) {
688      this.blockNumber.decrement();
689      if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
690        fileNotFullyCached(cacheKey.getHfileName());
691      }
692    }
693    if (evictedByEvictionProcess) {
694      cacheStats.evicted(bucketEntry.getCachedTime(), cacheKey.isPrimary());
695    }
696    if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
697      setCacheInconsistent(true);
698    }
699  }
700
701  private void fileNotFullyCached(String hfileName) {
702    // Update the regionPrefetchedSizeMap before removing the file from prefetchCompleted
703    if (fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(hfileName)) {
704      Pair<String, Long> regionEntry = fullyCachedFiles.get(hfileName);
705      String regionEncodedName = regionEntry.getFirst();
706      long filePrefetchSize = regionEntry.getSecond();
707      LOG.debug("Removing file {} for region {}", hfileName, regionEncodedName);
708      regionCachedSize.computeIfPresent(regionEncodedName, (rn, pf) -> pf - filePrefetchSize);
709      // If all the blocks for a region are evicted from the cache, remove the entry for that region
710      if (
711        regionCachedSize.containsKey(regionEncodedName)
712          && regionCachedSize.get(regionEncodedName) == 0
713      ) {
714        regionCachedSize.remove(regionEncodedName);
715      }
716    }
717    fullyCachedFiles.remove(hfileName);
718  }
719
720  public void fileCacheCompleted(Path filePath, long size) {
721    Pair<String, Long> pair = new Pair<>();
722    // sets the region name
723    String regionName = filePath.getParent().getParent().getName();
724    pair.setFirst(regionName);
725    pair.setSecond(size);
726    fullyCachedFiles.put(filePath.getName(), pair);
727  }
728
729  private void updateRegionCachedSize(Path filePath, long cachedSize) {
730    if (filePath != null) {
731      String regionName = filePath.getParent().getParent().getName();
732      regionCachedSize.merge(regionName, cachedSize,
733        (previousSize, newBlockSize) -> previousSize + newBlockSize);
734    }
735  }
736
737  /**
738   * Free the {{@link BucketEntry} actually,which could only be invoked when the
739   * {@link BucketEntry#refCnt} becoming 0.
740   */
741  void freeBucketEntry(BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
742    bucketAllocator.freeBlock(bucketEntry.offset(), bucketEntry.getLength());
743    realCacheSize.add(-1 * bucketEntry.getLength());
744  }
745
746  /**
747   * Try to evict the block from {@link BlockCache} by force. We'll call this in few cases:<br>
748   * 1. Close an HFile, and clear all cached blocks. <br>
749   * 2. Call {@link Admin#clearBlockCache(TableName)} to clear all blocks for a given table.<br>
750   * <p>
751   * Firstly, we'll try to remove the block from RAMCache,and then try to evict from backingMap.
752   * Here we evict the block from backingMap immediately, but only free the reference from bucket
753   * cache by calling {@link BucketEntry#markedAsEvicted}. If there're still some RPC referring this
754   * block, block can only be de-allocated when all of them release the block.
755   * <p>
756   * NOTICE: we need to grab the write offset lock firstly before releasing the reference from
757   * bucket cache. if we don't, we may read an {@link BucketEntry} with refCnt = 0 when
758   * {@link BucketCache#getBlock(BlockCacheKey, boolean, boolean, boolean)}, it's a memory leak.
759   * @param cacheKey Block to evict
760   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
761   */
762  @Override
763  public boolean evictBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
764    return doEvictBlock(cacheKey, null, false);
765  }
766
767  /**
768   * Evict the {@link BlockCacheKey} and {@link BucketEntry} from {@link BucketCache#backingMap} and
769   * {@link BucketCache#ramCache}. <br/>
770   * NOTE:When Evict from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},only the matched {@link BlockCacheKey} and
771   * {@link BucketEntry} could be removed.
772   * @param cacheKey    {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
773   * @param bucketEntry {@link BucketEntry} matched {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
774   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
775   */
776  private boolean doEvictBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry,
777    boolean evictedByEvictionProcess) {
778    if (!cacheEnabled) {
779      return false;
780    }
781    boolean existedInRamCache = removeFromRamCache(cacheKey);
782    if (bucketEntry == null) {
783      bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
784    }
785    final BucketEntry bucketEntryToUse = bucketEntry;
786
787    if (bucketEntryToUse == null) {
788      if (existedInRamCache && evictedByEvictionProcess) {
789        cacheStats.evicted(0, cacheKey.isPrimary());
790      }
791      return existedInRamCache;
792    } else {
793      return bucketEntryToUse.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
794        if (backingMap.remove(cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse)) {
795          LOG.debug("removed key {} from back map with offset lock {} in the evict process",
796            cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse.offset());
797          blockEvicted(cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse, !existedInRamCache, evictedByEvictionProcess);
798          return true;
799        }
800        return false;
801      });
802    }
803  }
804
805  /**
806   * <pre>
807   * Create the {@link Recycler} for {@link BucketEntry#refCnt},which would be used as
808   * {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} returned from {@link BucketCache#getBlock}.
809   * NOTE: for {@link BucketCache#getBlock},the {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf}
810   * from {@link BucketCache#backingMap} and {@link BucketCache#ramCache} are different:
811   * 1.For {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},
812   *   it is the return value of current {@link BucketCache#createRecycler} method.
813   *
814   * 2.For {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} from {@link BucketCache#ramCache},
815   *   it is {@link ByteBuffAllocator#putbackBuffer}.
816   * </pre>
817   */
818  private Recycler createRecycler(final BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
819    return () -> {
820      freeBucketEntry(bucketEntry);
821      return;
822    };
823  }
824
825  /**
826   * NOTE: This method is only for test.
827   */
828  public boolean evictBlockIfNoRpcReferenced(BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey) {
829    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(blockCacheKey);
830    if (bucketEntry == null) {
831      return false;
832    }
833    return evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(blockCacheKey, bucketEntry);
834  }
835
836  /**
837   * Evict {@link BlockCacheKey} and its corresponding {@link BucketEntry} only if
838   * {@link BucketEntry#isRpcRef} is false. <br/>
839   * NOTE:When evict from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},only the matched {@link BlockCacheKey} and
840   * {@link BucketEntry} could be removed.
841   * @param blockCacheKey {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
842   * @param bucketEntry   {@link BucketEntry} matched {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
843   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
844   */
845  boolean evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
846    if (!bucketEntry.isRpcRef()) {
847      return doEvictBlock(blockCacheKey, bucketEntry, true);
848    }
849    return false;
850  }
851
852  protected boolean removeFromRamCache(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
853    return ramCache.remove(cacheKey, re -> {
854      if (re != null) {
855        this.blockNumber.decrement();
856        this.heapSize.add(-1 * re.getData().heapSize());
857      }
858    });
859  }
860
861  public boolean isCacheInconsistent() {
862    return isCacheInconsistent.get();
863  }
864
865  public void setCacheInconsistent(boolean setCacheInconsistent) {
866    isCacheInconsistent.set(setCacheInconsistent);
867  }
868
869  /*
870   * Statistics thread. Periodically output cache statistics to the log.
871   */
872  private static class StatisticsThread extends Thread {
873    private final BucketCache bucketCache;
874
875    public StatisticsThread(BucketCache bucketCache) {
876      super("BucketCacheStatsThread");
877      setDaemon(true);
878      this.bucketCache = bucketCache;
879    }
880
881    @Override
882    public void run() {
883      bucketCache.logStats();
884    }
885  }
886
887  public void logStats() {
888    long totalSize = bucketAllocator.getTotalSize();
889    long usedSize = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
890    long freeSize = totalSize - usedSize;
891    long cacheSize = getRealCacheSize();
892    LOG.info("failedBlockAdditions=" + cacheStats.getFailedInserts() + ", " + "totalSize="
893      + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize) + ", " + "freeSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(freeSize) + ", "
894      + "usedSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(usedSize) + ", " + "cacheSize="
895      + StringUtils.byteDesc(cacheSize) + ", " + "accesses=" + cacheStats.getRequestCount() + ", "
896      + "hits=" + cacheStats.getHitCount() + ", " + "IOhitsPerSecond="
897      + cacheStats.getIOHitsPerSecond() + ", " + "IOTimePerHit="
898      + String.format("%.2f", cacheStats.getIOTimePerHit()) + ", " + "hitRatio="
899      + (cacheStats.getHitCount() == 0
900        ? "0,"
901        : (StringUtils.formatPercent(cacheStats.getHitRatio(), 2) + ", "))
902      + "cachingAccesses=" + cacheStats.getRequestCachingCount() + ", " + "cachingHits="
903      + cacheStats.getHitCachingCount() + ", " + "cachingHitsRatio="
904      + (cacheStats.getHitCachingCount() == 0
905        ? "0,"
906        : (StringUtils.formatPercent(cacheStats.getHitCachingRatio(), 2) + ", "))
907      + "evictions=" + cacheStats.getEvictionCount() + ", " + "evicted="
908      + cacheStats.getEvictedCount() + ", " + "evictedPerRun=" + cacheStats.evictedPerEviction()
909      + ", " + "allocationFailCount=" + cacheStats.getAllocationFailCount());
910    cacheStats.reset();
911
912    bucketAllocator.logDebugStatistics();
913  }
914
915  public long getRealCacheSize() {
916    return this.realCacheSize.sum();
917  }
918
919  public long acceptableSize() {
920    return (long) Math.floor(bucketAllocator.getTotalSize() * acceptableFactor);
921  }
922
923  long getPartitionSize(float partitionFactor) {
924    return (long) Math.floor(bucketAllocator.getTotalSize() * partitionFactor * minFactor);
925  }
926
927  /**
928   * Return the count of bucketSizeinfos still need free space
929   */
930  private int bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(float minFactor) {
931    BucketAllocator.IndexStatistics[] stats = bucketAllocator.getIndexStatistics();
932    int fullCount = 0;
933    for (int i = 0; i < stats.length; i++) {
934      long freeGoal = (long) Math.floor(stats[i].totalCount() * (1 - minFactor));
935      freeGoal = Math.max(freeGoal, 1);
936      if (stats[i].freeCount() < freeGoal) {
937        fullCount++;
938      }
939    }
940    return fullCount;
941  }
942
943  /**
944   * This method will find the buckets that are minimally occupied and are not reference counted and
945   * will free them completely without any constraint on the access times of the elements, and as a
946   * process will completely free at most the number of buckets passed, sometimes it might not due
947   * to changing refCounts
948   * @param completelyFreeBucketsNeeded number of buckets to free
949   **/
950  private void freeEntireBuckets(int completelyFreeBucketsNeeded) {
951    if (completelyFreeBucketsNeeded != 0) {
952      // First we will build a set where the offsets are reference counted, usually
953      // this set is small around O(Handler Count) unless something else is wrong
954      Set<Integer> inUseBuckets = new HashSet<>();
955      backingMap.forEach((k, be) -> {
956        if (be.isRpcRef()) {
957          inUseBuckets.add(bucketAllocator.getBucketIndex(be.offset()));
958        }
959      });
960      Set<Integer> candidateBuckets =
961        bucketAllocator.getLeastFilledBuckets(inUseBuckets, completelyFreeBucketsNeeded);
962      for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> entry : backingMap.entrySet()) {
963        if (candidateBuckets.contains(bucketAllocator.getBucketIndex(entry.getValue().offset()))) {
964          evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
965        }
966      }
967    }
968  }
969
970  /**
971   * Free the space if the used size reaches acceptableSize() or one size block couldn't be
972   * allocated. When freeing the space, we use the LRU algorithm and ensure there must be some
973   * blocks evicted
974   * @param why Why we are being called
975   */
976  void freeSpace(final String why) {
977    // Ensure only one freeSpace progress at a time
978    if (!freeSpaceLock.tryLock()) {
979      return;
980    }
981    try {
982      freeInProgress = true;
983      long bytesToFreeWithoutExtra = 0;
984      // Calculate free byte for each bucketSizeinfo
985      StringBuilder msgBuffer = LOG.isDebugEnabled() ? new StringBuilder() : null;
986      BucketAllocator.IndexStatistics[] stats = bucketAllocator.getIndexStatistics();
987      long[] bytesToFreeForBucket = new long[stats.length];
988      for (int i = 0; i < stats.length; i++) {
989        bytesToFreeForBucket[i] = 0;
990        long freeGoal = (long) Math.floor(stats[i].totalCount() * (1 - minFactor));
991        freeGoal = Math.max(freeGoal, 1);
992        if (stats[i].freeCount() < freeGoal) {
993          bytesToFreeForBucket[i] = stats[i].itemSize() * (freeGoal - stats[i].freeCount());
994          bytesToFreeWithoutExtra += bytesToFreeForBucket[i];
995          if (msgBuffer != null) {
996            msgBuffer.append("Free for bucketSize(" + stats[i].itemSize() + ")="
997              + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesToFreeForBucket[i]) + ", ");
998          }
999        }
1000      }
1001      if (msgBuffer != null) {
1002        msgBuffer.append("Free for total=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesToFreeWithoutExtra) + ", ");
1003      }
1004
1005      if (bytesToFreeWithoutExtra <= 0) {
1006        return;
1007      }
1008      long currentSize = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
1009      long totalSize = bucketAllocator.getTotalSize();
1010      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled() && msgBuffer != null) {
1011        LOG.debug("Free started because \"" + why + "\"; " + msgBuffer.toString()
1012          + " of current used=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(currentSize) + ", actual cacheSize="
1013          + StringUtils.byteDesc(realCacheSize.sum()) + ", total="
1014          + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize));
1015      }
1016
1017      long bytesToFreeWithExtra =
1018        (long) Math.floor(bytesToFreeWithoutExtra * (1 + extraFreeFactor));
1019
1020      // Instantiate priority buckets
1021      BucketEntryGroup bucketSingle =
1022        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(singleFactor));
1023      BucketEntryGroup bucketMulti =
1024        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(multiFactor));
1025      BucketEntryGroup bucketMemory =
1026        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(memoryFactor));
1027
1028      // Scan entire map putting bucket entry into appropriate bucket entry
1029      // group
1030      for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> bucketEntryWithKey : backingMap.entrySet()) {
1031        switch (bucketEntryWithKey.getValue().getPriority()) {
1032          case SINGLE: {
1033            bucketSingle.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1034            break;
1035          }
1036          case MULTI: {
1037            bucketMulti.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1038            break;
1039          }
1040          case MEMORY: {
1041            bucketMemory.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1042            break;
1043          }
1044        }
1045      }
1046
1047      PriorityQueue<BucketEntryGroup> bucketQueue =
1048        new PriorityQueue<>(3, Comparator.comparingLong(BucketEntryGroup::overflow));
1049
1050      bucketQueue.add(bucketSingle);
1051      bucketQueue.add(bucketMulti);
1052      bucketQueue.add(bucketMemory);
1053
1054      int remainingBuckets = bucketQueue.size();
1055      long bytesFreed = 0;
1056
1057      BucketEntryGroup bucketGroup;
1058      while ((bucketGroup = bucketQueue.poll()) != null) {
1059        long overflow = bucketGroup.overflow();
1060        if (overflow > 0) {
1061          long bucketBytesToFree =
1062            Math.min(overflow, (bytesToFreeWithoutExtra - bytesFreed) / remainingBuckets);
1063          bytesFreed += bucketGroup.free(bucketBytesToFree);
1064        }
1065        remainingBuckets--;
1066      }
1067
1068      // Check and free if there are buckets that still need freeing of space
1069      if (bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(minFactor) > 0) {
1070        bucketQueue.clear();
1071        remainingBuckets = 3;
1072
1073        bucketQueue.add(bucketSingle);
1074        bucketQueue.add(bucketMulti);
1075        bucketQueue.add(bucketMemory);
1076
1077        while ((bucketGroup = bucketQueue.poll()) != null) {
1078          long bucketBytesToFree = (bytesToFreeWithExtra - bytesFreed) / remainingBuckets;
1079          bytesFreed += bucketGroup.free(bucketBytesToFree);
1080          remainingBuckets--;
1081        }
1082      }
1083
1084      // Even after the above free we might still need freeing because of the
1085      // De-fragmentation of the buckets (also called Slab Calcification problem), i.e
1086      // there might be some buckets where the occupancy is very sparse and thus are not
1087      // yielding the free for the other bucket sizes, the fix for this to evict some
1088      // of the buckets, we do this by evicting the buckets that are least fulled
1089      freeEntireBuckets(DEFAULT_FREE_ENTIRE_BLOCK_FACTOR * bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(1.0f));
1090
1091      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1092        long single = bucketSingle.totalSize();
1093        long multi = bucketMulti.totalSize();
1094        long memory = bucketMemory.totalSize();
1095        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1096          LOG.debug("Bucket cache free space completed; " + "freed="
1097            + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesFreed) + ", " + "total=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize)
1098            + ", " + "single=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(single) + ", " + "multi="
1099            + StringUtils.byteDesc(multi) + ", " + "memory=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(memory));
1100        }
1101      }
1102
1103    } catch (Throwable t) {
1104      LOG.warn("Failed freeing space", t);
1105    } finally {
1106      cacheStats.evict();
1107      freeInProgress = false;
1108      freeSpaceLock.unlock();
1109    }
1110  }
1111
1112  // This handles flushing the RAM cache to IOEngine.
1113  class WriterThread extends Thread {
1114    private final BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> inputQueue;
1115    private volatile boolean writerEnabled = true;
1116    private final ByteBuffer metaBuff = ByteBuffer.allocate(HFileBlock.BLOCK_METADATA_SPACE);
1117
1118    WriterThread(BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> queue) {
1119      super("BucketCacheWriterThread");
1120      this.inputQueue = queue;
1121    }
1122
1123    // Used for test
1124    void disableWriter() {
1125      this.writerEnabled = false;
1126    }
1127
1128    @Override
1129    public void run() {
1130      List<RAMQueueEntry> entries = new ArrayList<>();
1131      try {
1132        while (cacheEnabled && writerEnabled) {
1133          try {
1134            try {
1135              // Blocks
1136              entries = getRAMQueueEntries(inputQueue, entries);
1137            } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1138              if (!cacheEnabled || !writerEnabled) {
1139                break;
1140              }
1141            }
1142            doDrain(entries, metaBuff);
1143          } catch (Exception ioe) {
1144            LOG.error("WriterThread encountered error", ioe);
1145          }
1146        }
1147      } catch (Throwable t) {
1148        LOG.warn("Failed doing drain", t);
1149      }
1150      LOG.info(this.getName() + " exiting, cacheEnabled=" + cacheEnabled);
1151    }
1152  }
1153
1154  /**
1155   * Put the new bucket entry into backingMap. Notice that we are allowed to replace the existing
1156   * cache with a new block for the same cache key. there's a corner case: one thread cache a block
1157   * in ramCache, copy to io-engine and add a bucket entry to backingMap. Caching another new block
1158   * with the same cache key do the same thing for the same cache key, so if not evict the previous
1159   * bucket entry, then memory leak happen because the previous bucketEntry is gone but the
1160   * bucketAllocator do not free its memory.
1161   * @see BlockCacheUtil#shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(BlockCache blockCache,BlockCacheKey
1162   *      cacheKey, Cacheable newBlock)
1163   * @param key         Block cache key
1164   * @param bucketEntry Bucket entry to put into backingMap.
1165   */
1166  protected void putIntoBackingMap(BlockCacheKey key, BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
1167    BucketEntry previousEntry = backingMap.put(key, bucketEntry);
1168    blocksByHFile.add(key);
1169    updateRegionCachedSize(key.getFilePath(), bucketEntry.getLength());
1170    if (previousEntry != null && previousEntry != bucketEntry) {
1171      previousEntry.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
1172        blockEvicted(key, previousEntry, false, false);
1173        return null;
1174      });
1175    }
1176  }
1177
1178  /**
1179   * Prepare and return a warning message for Bucket Allocator Exception
1180   * @param fle The exception
1181   * @param re  The RAMQueueEntry for which the exception was thrown.
1182   * @return A warning message created from the input RAMQueueEntry object.
1183   */
1184  private static String getAllocationFailWarningMessage(final BucketAllocatorException fle,
1185    final RAMQueueEntry re) {
1186    final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1187    sb.append("Most recent failed allocation after ");
1188    sb.append(ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD);
1189    sb.append(" ms;");
1190    if (re != null) {
1191      if (re.getData() instanceof HFileBlock) {
1192        final HFileContext fileContext = ((HFileBlock) re.getData()).getHFileContext();
1193        final String columnFamily = Bytes.toString(fileContext.getColumnFamily());
1194        final String tableName = Bytes.toString(fileContext.getTableName());
1195        if (tableName != null) {
1196          sb.append(" Table: ");
1197          sb.append(tableName);
1198        }
1199        if (columnFamily != null) {
1200          sb.append(" CF: ");
1201          sb.append(columnFamily);
1202        }
1203        sb.append(" HFile: ");
1204        if (fileContext.getHFileName() != null) {
1205          sb.append(fileContext.getHFileName());
1206        } else {
1207          sb.append(re.getKey());
1208        }
1209      } else {
1210        sb.append(" HFile: ");
1211        sb.append(re.getKey());
1212      }
1213    }
1214    sb.append(" Message: ");
1215    sb.append(fle.getMessage());
1216    return sb.toString();
1217  }
1218
1219  /**
1220   * Flush the entries in ramCache to IOEngine and add bucket entry to backingMap. Process all that
1221   * are passed in even if failure being sure to remove from ramCache else we'll never undo the
1222   * references and we'll OOME.
1223   * @param entries Presumes list passed in here will be processed by this invocation only. No
1224   *                interference expected.
1225   */
1226  void doDrain(final List<RAMQueueEntry> entries, ByteBuffer metaBuff) throws InterruptedException {
1227    if (entries.isEmpty()) {
1228      return;
1229    }
1230    // This method is a little hard to follow. We run through the passed in entries and for each
1231    // successful add, we add a non-null BucketEntry to the below bucketEntries. Later we must
1232    // do cleanup making sure we've cleared ramCache of all entries regardless of whether we
1233    // successfully added the item to the bucketcache; if we don't do the cleanup, we'll OOME by
1234    // filling ramCache. We do the clean up by again running through the passed in entries
1235    // doing extra work when we find a non-null bucketEntries corresponding entry.
1236    final int size = entries.size();
1237    BucketEntry[] bucketEntries = new BucketEntry[size];
1238    // Index updated inside loop if success or if we can't succeed. We retry if cache is full
1239    // when we go to add an entry by going around the loop again without upping the index.
1240    int index = 0;
1241    while (cacheEnabled && index < size) {
1242      RAMQueueEntry re = null;
1243      try {
1244        re = entries.get(index);
1245        if (re == null) {
1246          LOG.warn("Couldn't get entry or changed on us; who else is messing with it?");
1247          index++;
1248          continue;
1249        }
1250        // Reset the position for reuse.
1251        // It should be guaranteed that the data in the metaBuff has been transferred to the
1252        // ioEngine safely. Otherwise, this reuse is problematic. Fortunately, the data is already
1253        // transferred with our current IOEngines. Should take care, when we have new kinds of
1254        // IOEngine in the future.
1255        metaBuff.clear();
1256        BucketEntry bucketEntry =
1257          re.writeToCache(ioEngine, bucketAllocator, realCacheSize, this::createRecycler, metaBuff);
1258        // Successfully added. Up index and add bucketEntry. Clear io exceptions.
1259        bucketEntries[index] = bucketEntry;
1260        if (ioErrorStartTime > 0) {
1261          ioErrorStartTime = -1;
1262        }
1263        index++;
1264      } catch (BucketAllocatorException fle) {
1265        long currTs = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1266        cacheStats.allocationFailed(); // Record the warning.
1267        if (
1268          allocFailLogPrevTs == 0 || (currTs - allocFailLogPrevTs) > ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD
1269        ) {
1270          LOG.warn(getAllocationFailWarningMessage(fle, re));
1271          allocFailLogPrevTs = currTs;
1272        }
1273        // Presume can't add. Too big? Move index on. Entry will be cleared from ramCache below.
1274        bucketEntries[index] = null;
1275        index++;
1276      } catch (CacheFullException cfe) {
1277        // Cache full when we tried to add. Try freeing space and then retrying (don't up index)
1278        if (!freeInProgress) {
1279          freeSpace("Full!");
1280        } else {
1281          Thread.sleep(50);
1282        }
1283      } catch (IOException ioex) {
1284        // Hopefully transient. Retry. checkIOErrorIsTolerated disables cache if problem.
1285        LOG.error("Failed writing to bucket cache", ioex);
1286        checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
1287      }
1288    }
1289
1290    // Make sure data pages are written on media before we update maps.
1291    try {
1292      ioEngine.sync();
1293    } catch (IOException ioex) {
1294      LOG.error("Failed syncing IO engine", ioex);
1295      checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
1296      // Since we failed sync, free the blocks in bucket allocator
1297      for (int i = 0; i < entries.size(); ++i) {
1298        BucketEntry bucketEntry = bucketEntries[i];
1299        if (bucketEntry != null) {
1300          bucketAllocator.freeBlock(bucketEntry.offset(), bucketEntry.getLength());
1301          bucketEntries[i] = null;
1302        }
1303      }
1304    }
1305
1306    // Now add to backingMap if successfully added to bucket cache. Remove from ramCache if
1307    // success or error.
1308    for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1309      BlockCacheKey key = entries.get(i).getKey();
1310      // Only add if non-null entry.
1311      if (bucketEntries[i] != null) {
1312        putIntoBackingMap(key, bucketEntries[i]);
1313        if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
1314          setCacheInconsistent(true);
1315        }
1316      }
1317      // Always remove from ramCache even if we failed adding it to the block cache above.
1318      boolean existed = ramCache.remove(key, re -> {
1319        if (re != null) {
1320          heapSize.add(-1 * re.getData().heapSize());
1321        }
1322      });
1323      if (!existed && bucketEntries[i] != null) {
1324        // Block should have already been evicted. Remove it and free space.
1325        final BucketEntry bucketEntry = bucketEntries[i];
1326        bucketEntry.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
1327          if (backingMap.remove(key, bucketEntry)) {
1328            blockEvicted(key, bucketEntry, false, false);
1329          }
1330          return null;
1331        });
1332      }
1333    }
1334
1335    long used = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
1336    if (used > acceptableSize()) {
1337      freeSpace("Used=" + used + " > acceptable=" + acceptableSize());
1338    }
1339    return;
1340  }
1341
1342  /**
1343   * Blocks until elements available in {@code q} then tries to grab as many as possible before
1344   * returning.
1345   * @param receptacle Where to stash the elements taken from queue. We clear before we use it just
1346   *                   in case.
1347   * @param q          The queue to take from.
1348   * @return {@code receptacle} laden with elements taken from the queue or empty if none found.
1349   */
1350  static List<RAMQueueEntry> getRAMQueueEntries(BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> q,
1351    List<RAMQueueEntry> receptacle) throws InterruptedException {
1352    // Clear sets all entries to null and sets size to 0. We retain allocations. Presume it
1353    // ok even if list grew to accommodate thousands.
1354    receptacle.clear();
1355    receptacle.add(q.take());
1356    q.drainTo(receptacle);
1357    return receptacle;
1358  }
1359
1360  /**
1361   * @see #retrieveFromFile(int[])
1362   */
1363  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "OBL_UNSATISFIED_OBLIGATION",
1364      justification = "false positive, try-with-resources ensures close is called.")
1365  void persistToFile() throws IOException {
1366    LOG.debug("Thread {} started persisting bucket cache to file",
1367      Thread.currentThread().getName());
1368    if (!isCachePersistent()) {
1369      throw new IOException("Attempt to persist non-persistent cache mappings!");
1370    }
1371    File tempPersistencePath = new File(persistencePath + EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
1372    try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(tempPersistencePath, false)) {
1373      LOG.debug("Persist in new chunked persistence format.");
1374      persistChunkedBackingMap(fos);
1375    } catch (IOException e) {
1376      LOG.error("Failed to persist bucket cache to file", e);
1377      throw e;
1378    }
1379    LOG.debug("Thread {} finished persisting bucket cache to file, renaming",
1380      Thread.currentThread().getName());
1381    if (!tempPersistencePath.renameTo(new File(persistencePath))) {
1382      LOG.warn("Failed to commit cache persistent file. We might lose cached blocks if "
1383        + "RS crashes/restarts before we successfully checkpoint again.");
1384    }
1385  }
1386
1387  public boolean isCachePersistent() {
1388    return ioEngine.isPersistent() && persistencePath != null;
1389  }
1390
1391  @Override
1392  public Optional<Map<String, Long>> getRegionCachedInfo() {
1393    return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(regionCachedSize));
1394  }
1395
1396  /**
1397   * @see #persistToFile()
1398   */
1399  private void retrieveFromFile(int[] bucketSizes) throws IOException {
1400    LOG.info("Started retrieving bucket cache from file");
1401    File persistenceFile = new File(persistencePath);
1402    if (!persistenceFile.exists()) {
1403      LOG.warn("Persistence file missing! "
1404        + "It's ok if it's first run after enabling persistent cache.");
1405      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(cacheCapacity, bucketSizes, backingMap, realCacheSize);
1406      blockNumber.add(backingMap.size());
1407      backingMapValidated.set(true);
1408      return;
1409    }
1410    assert !cacheEnabled;
1411
1412    try (FileInputStream in = new FileInputStream(persistenceFile)) {
1413      int pblen = ProtobufMagic.lengthOfPBMagic();
1414      byte[] pbuf = new byte[pblen];
1415      int read = in.read(pbuf);
1416      if (read != pblen) {
1417        throw new IOException("Incorrect number of bytes read while checking for protobuf magic "
1418          + "number. Requested=" + pblen + ", Received= " + read + ", File=" + persistencePath);
1419      }
1420      if (ProtobufMagic.isPBMagicPrefix(pbuf)) {
1421        LOG.info("Reading old format of persistence.");
1422        // The old non-chunked version of backing map persistence.
1423        parsePB(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry.parseDelimitedFrom(in));
1424      } else if (Arrays.equals(pbuf, BucketProtoUtils.PB_MAGIC_V2)) {
1425        // The new persistence format of chunked persistence.
1426        LOG.info("Reading new chunked format of persistence.");
1427        retrieveChunkedBackingMap(in, bucketSizes);
1428      } else {
1429        // In 3.0 we have enough flexibility to dump the old cache data.
1430        // TODO: In 2.x line, this might need to be filled in to support reading the old format
1431        throw new IOException(
1432          "Persistence file does not start with protobuf magic number. " + persistencePath);
1433      }
1434      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(cacheCapacity, bucketSizes, backingMap, realCacheSize);
1435      blockNumber.add(backingMap.size());
1436      LOG.info("Bucket cache retrieved from file successfully with size: {}", backingMap.size());
1437    }
1438  }
1439
1440  private void updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile() {
1441    // Update the regionCachedSize with the region size while restarting the region server
1442    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1443      LOG.debug("Updating region size map after retrieving cached file list");
1444      dumpPrefetchList();
1445    }
1446    regionCachedSize.clear();
1447    fullyCachedFiles.forEach((hFileName, hFileSize) -> {
1448      // Get the region name for each file
1449      String regionEncodedName = hFileSize.getFirst();
1450      long cachedFileSize = hFileSize.getSecond();
1451      regionCachedSize.merge(regionEncodedName, cachedFileSize,
1452        (oldpf, fileSize) -> oldpf + fileSize);
1453    });
1454  }
1455
1456  private void dumpPrefetchList() {
1457    for (Map.Entry<String, Pair<String, Long>> outerEntry : fullyCachedFiles.entrySet()) {
1458      LOG.debug("Cached File Entry:<{},<{},{}>>", outerEntry.getKey(),
1459        outerEntry.getValue().getFirst(), outerEntry.getValue().getSecond());
1460    }
1461  }
1462
1463  private void verifyCapacityAndClasses(long capacitySize, String ioclass, String mapclass)
1464    throws IOException {
1465    if (capacitySize != cacheCapacity) {
1466      throw new IOException("Mismatched cache capacity:" + StringUtils.byteDesc(capacitySize)
1467        + ", expected: " + StringUtils.byteDesc(cacheCapacity));
1468    }
1469    if (!ioEngine.getClass().getName().equals(ioclass)) {
1470      throw new IOException("Class name for IO engine mismatch: " + ioclass + ", expected:"
1471        + ioEngine.getClass().getName());
1472    }
1473    if (!backingMap.getClass().getName().equals(mapclass)) {
1474      throw new IOException("Class name for cache map mismatch: " + mapclass + ", expected:"
1475        + backingMap.getClass().getName());
1476    }
1477  }
1478
1479  private void verifyFileIntegrity(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry proto) {
1480    try {
1481      if (proto.hasChecksum()) {
1482        ((PersistentIOEngine) ioEngine).verifyFileIntegrity(proto.getChecksum().toByteArray(),
1483          algorithm);
1484      }
1485      backingMapValidated.set(true);
1486    } catch (IOException e) {
1487      LOG.warn("Checksum for cache file failed. "
1488        + "We need to validate each cache key in the backing map. "
1489        + "This may take some time, so we'll do it in a background thread,");
1490
1491      Runnable cacheValidator = () -> {
1492        while (bucketAllocator == null) {
1493          try {
1494            Thread.sleep(50);
1495          } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1496            throw new RuntimeException(ex);
1497          }
1498        }
1499        long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1500        int totalKeysOriginally = backingMap.size();
1501        for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> keyEntry : backingMap.entrySet()) {
1502          try {
1503            ((FileIOEngine) ioEngine).checkCacheTime(keyEntry.getValue());
1504          } catch (IOException e1) {
1505            LOG.debug("Check for key {} failed. Evicting.", keyEntry.getKey());
1506            evictBlock(keyEntry.getKey());
1507            fileNotFullyCached(keyEntry.getKey().getHfileName());
1508          }
1509        }
1510        backingMapValidated.set(true);
1511        LOG.info("Finished validating {} keys in the backing map. Recovered: {}. This took {}ms.",
1512          totalKeysOriginally, backingMap.size(),
1513          (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - startTime));
1514      };
1515      Thread t = new Thread(cacheValidator);
1516      t.setDaemon(true);
1517      t.start();
1518    }
1519  }
1520
1521  private void parsePB(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry firstChunk,
1522    List<BucketCacheProtos.BackingMap> chunks) throws IOException {
1523    fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1524    Pair<ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>, NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey>> pair =
1525      BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(firstChunk.getDeserializersMap(), firstChunk.getBackingMap(),
1526        this::createRecycler);
1527    backingMap.putAll(pair.getFirst());
1528    blocksByHFile.addAll(pair.getSecond());
1529    fullyCachedFiles.putAll(BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(firstChunk.getCachedFilesMap()));
1530
1531    LOG.debug("Number of blocks after first chunk: {}, blocksByHFile: {}", backingMap.size(),
1532      fullyCachedFiles.size());
1533    int i = 1;
1534    for (BucketCacheProtos.BackingMap chunk : chunks) {
1535      Pair<ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>, NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey>> pair2 =
1536        BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(firstChunk.getDeserializersMap(), chunk, this::createRecycler);
1537      backingMap.putAll(pair2.getFirst());
1538      blocksByHFile.addAll(pair2.getSecond());
1539      LOG.debug("Number of blocks after {} reading chunk: {}, blocksByHFile: {}", ++i,
1540        backingMap.size(), fullyCachedFiles.size());
1541    }
1542    verifyFileIntegrity(firstChunk);
1543    verifyCapacityAndClasses(firstChunk.getCacheCapacity(), firstChunk.getIoClass(),
1544      firstChunk.getMapClass());
1545    updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile();
1546  }
1547
1548  private void parsePB(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry proto) throws IOException {
1549    Pair<ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>, NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey>> pair =
1550      BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(proto.getDeserializersMap(), proto.getBackingMap(),
1551        this::createRecycler);
1552    backingMap = pair.getFirst();
1553    blocksByHFile = pair.getSecond();
1554    fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1555    fullyCachedFiles.putAll(BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(proto.getCachedFilesMap()));
1556    verifyFileIntegrity(proto);
1557    updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile();
1558    verifyCapacityAndClasses(proto.getCacheCapacity(), proto.getIoClass(), proto.getMapClass());
1559  }
1560
1561  private void persistChunkedBackingMap(FileOutputStream fos) throws IOException {
1562    long numChunks = backingMap.size() / persistenceChunkSize;
1563    if (backingMap.size() % persistenceChunkSize != 0) {
1564      numChunks += 1;
1565    }
1566
1567    LOG.debug(
1568      "persistToFile: before persisting backing map size: {}, "
1569        + "fullycachedFiles size: {}, chunkSize: {}, numberofChunks: {}",
1570      backingMap.size(), fullyCachedFiles.size(), persistenceChunkSize, numChunks);
1571
1572    BucketProtoUtils.serializeAsPB(this, fos, persistenceChunkSize, numChunks);
1573
1574    LOG.debug(
1575      "persistToFile: after persisting backing map size: {}, "
1576        + "fullycachedFiles size: {}, numChunksPersisteed: {}",
1577      backingMap.size(), fullyCachedFiles.size(), numChunks);
1578  }
1579
1580  private void retrieveChunkedBackingMap(FileInputStream in, int[] bucketSizes) throws IOException {
1581    byte[] bytes = new byte[Long.BYTES];
1582    int readSize = in.read(bytes);
1583    if (readSize != Long.BYTES) {
1584      throw new IOException("Invalid size of chunk-size read from persistence: " + readSize);
1585    }
1586    long batchSize = Bytes.toLong(bytes, 0);
1587
1588    readSize = in.read(bytes);
1589    if (readSize != Long.BYTES) {
1590      throw new IOException("Invalid size for number of chunks read from persistence: " + readSize);
1591    }
1592    long numChunks = Bytes.toLong(bytes, 0);
1593
1594    LOG.info("Number of chunks: {}, chunk size: {}", numChunks, batchSize);
1595
1596    ArrayList<BucketCacheProtos.BackingMap> bucketCacheMaps = new ArrayList<>();
1597    // Read the first chunk that has all the details.
1598    BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry firstChunk =
1599      BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry.parseDelimitedFrom(in);
1600
1601    // Subsequent chunks have the backingMap entries.
1602    for (int i = 1; i < numChunks; i++) {
1603      LOG.info("Reading chunk no: {}", i + 1);
1604      bucketCacheMaps.add(BucketCacheProtos.BackingMap.parseDelimitedFrom(in));
1605      LOG.info("Retrieved chunk: {}", i + 1);
1606    }
1607    parsePB(firstChunk, bucketCacheMaps);
1608  }
1609
1610  /**
1611   * Check whether we tolerate IO error this time. If the duration of IOEngine throwing errors
1612   * exceeds ioErrorsDurationTimeTolerated, we will disable the cache
1613   */
1614  private void checkIOErrorIsTolerated() {
1615    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1616    // Do a single read to a local variable to avoid timing issue - HBASE-24454
1617    long ioErrorStartTimeTmp = this.ioErrorStartTime;
1618    if (ioErrorStartTimeTmp > 0) {
1619      if (cacheEnabled && (now - ioErrorStartTimeTmp) > this.ioErrorsTolerationDuration) {
1620        LOG.error("IO errors duration time has exceeded " + ioErrorsTolerationDuration
1621          + "ms, disabling cache, please check your IOEngine");
1622        disableCache();
1623      }
1624    } else {
1625      this.ioErrorStartTime = now;
1626    }
1627  }
1628
1629  /**
1630   * Used to shut down the cache -or- turn it off in the case of something broken.
1631   */
1632  private void disableCache() {
1633    if (!cacheEnabled) return;
1634    LOG.info("Disabling cache");
1635    cacheEnabled = false;
1636    ioEngine.shutdown();
1637    this.scheduleThreadPool.shutdown();
1638    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i)
1639      writerThreads[i].interrupt();
1640    this.ramCache.clear();
1641    if (!ioEngine.isPersistent() || persistencePath == null) {
1642      // If persistent ioengine and a path, we will serialize out the backingMap.
1643      this.backingMap.clear();
1644      this.blocksByHFile.clear();
1645      this.fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1646      this.regionCachedSize.clear();
1647    }
1648  }
1649
1650  private void join() throws InterruptedException {
1651    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i)
1652      writerThreads[i].join();
1653  }
1654
1655  @Override
1656  public void shutdown() {
1657    disableCache();
1658    LOG.info("Shutdown bucket cache: IO persistent=" + ioEngine.isPersistent() + "; path to write="
1659      + persistencePath);
1660    if (ioEngine.isPersistent() && persistencePath != null) {
1661      try {
1662        join();
1663        if (cachePersister != null) {
1664          LOG.info("Shutting down cache persister thread.");
1665          cachePersister.shutdown();
1666          while (cachePersister.isAlive()) {
1667            Thread.sleep(10);
1668          }
1669        }
1670        persistToFile();
1671      } catch (IOException ex) {
1672        LOG.error("Unable to persist data on exit: " + ex.toString(), ex);
1673      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1674        LOG.warn("Failed to persist data on exit", e);
1675      }
1676    }
1677  }
1678
1679  /**
1680   * Needed mostly for UTs that might run in the same VM and create different BucketCache instances
1681   * on different UT methods.
1682   */
1683  @Override
1684  protected void finalize() {
1685    if (cachePersister != null && !cachePersister.isInterrupted()) {
1686      cachePersister.interrupt();
1687    }
1688  }
1689
1690  @Override
1691  public CacheStats getStats() {
1692    return cacheStats;
1693  }
1694
1695  public BucketAllocator getAllocator() {
1696    return this.bucketAllocator;
1697  }

1699  @Override

1701    return this.heapSize.sum();
1702  }

1705  public long size() {
1706    return this.realCacheSize.sum();
1707  }

1709  @Override
1710  public long getCurrentDataSize() {
1711    return size();
1712  }

1714  @Override
1715  public long getFreeSize() {
1716    return this.bucketAllocator.getFreeSize();
1717  }
