1719  @Override
1720  public long getBlockCount() {
1721    return this.blockNumber.sum();
1722  }
1723
1724  @Override
1725  public long getDataBlockCount() {
1726    return getBlockCount();
1727  }
1728
1729  @Override
1730  public long getCurrentSize() {
1731    return this.bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
1732  }
1733
1734  protected String getAlgorithm() {
1735    return algorithm;
1736  }
1737
1738  /**
1739   * Evicts all blocks for a specific HFile.
1740   * <p>
1741   * This is used for evict-on-close to remove all blocks of a specific HFile.
1742   * @return the number of blocks evicted
1743   */
1744  @Override
1745  public int evictBlocksByHfileName(String hfileName) {
1746    return evictBlocksRangeByHfileName(hfileName, 0, Long.MAX_VALUE);
1747  }
1748
1749  @Override
1750  public int evictBlocksRangeByHfileName(String hfileName, long initOffset, long endOffset) {
1751    fileNotFullyCached(hfileName);
1752    Set<BlockCacheKey> keySet = getAllCacheKeysForFile(hfileName, initOffset, endOffset);
1753    LOG.debug("found {} blocks for file {}, starting offset: {}, end offset: {}", keySet.size(),
1754      hfileName, initOffset, endOffset);
1755    int numEvicted = 0;
1756    for (BlockCacheKey key : keySet) {
1757      if (evictBlock(key)) {
1758        ++numEvicted;
1759      }
1760    }
1761    return numEvicted;
1762  }
1763
1764  private Set<BlockCacheKey> getAllCacheKeysForFile(String hfileName, long init, long end) {
1765    return blocksByHFile.subSet(new BlockCacheKey(hfileName, init), true,
1766      new BlockCacheKey(hfileName, end), true);
1767  }
1768
1769  /**
1770   * Used to group bucket entries into priority buckets. There will be a BucketEntryGroup for each
1771   * priority (single, multi, memory). Once bucketed, the eviction algorithm takes the appropriate
1772   * number of elements out of each according to configuration parameters and their relative sizes.
1773   */
1774  private class BucketEntryGroup {
1775
1776    private CachedEntryQueue queue;
1777    private long totalSize = 0;
1778    private long bucketSize;
1779
1780    public BucketEntryGroup(long bytesToFree, long blockSize, long bucketSize) {
1781      this.bucketSize = bucketSize;
1782      queue = new CachedEntryQueue(bytesToFree, blockSize);
1783      totalSize = 0;
1784    }
1785
1786    public void add(Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> block) {
1787      totalSize += block.getValue().getLength();
1788      queue.add(block);
1789    }
1790
1791    public long free(long toFree) {
1792      Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> entry;
1793      long freedBytes = 0;
1794      // TODO avoid a cycling siutation. We find no block which is not in use and so no way to free
1795      // What to do then? Caching attempt fail? Need some changes in cacheBlock API?
1796      while ((entry = queue.pollLast()) != null) {
1797        BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey = entry.getKey();
1798        BucketEntry be = entry.getValue();
1799        if (evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(blockCacheKey, be)) {
1800          freedBytes += be.getLength();
1801        }
1802        if (freedBytes >= toFree) {
1803          return freedBytes;
1804        }
1805      }
1806      return freedBytes;
1807    }
1808
1809    public long overflow() {
1810      return totalSize - bucketSize;
1811    }
1812
1813    public long totalSize() {
1814      return totalSize;
1815    }
1816  }
1817
1818  /**
1819   * Block Entry stored in the memory with key,data and so on
1820   */
1821  static class RAMQueueEntry {
1822    private final BlockCacheKey key;
1823    private final Cacheable data;
1824    private long accessCounter;
1825    private boolean inMemory;
1826    private boolean isCachePersistent;
1827
1828    RAMQueueEntry(BlockCacheKey bck, Cacheable data, long accessCounter, boolean inMemory,
1829      boolean isCachePersistent) {
1830      this.key = bck;
1831      this.data = data;
1832      this.accessCounter = accessCounter;
1833      this.inMemory = inMemory;
1834      this.isCachePersistent = isCachePersistent;
1835    }
1836
1837    public Cacheable getData() {
1838      return data;
1839    }
1840
1841    public BlockCacheKey getKey() {
1842      return key;
1843    }
1844
1845    public void access(long accessCounter) {
1846      this.accessCounter = accessCounter;
1847    }
1848
1849    private ByteBuffAllocator getByteBuffAllocator() {
1850      if (data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1851        return ((HFileBlock) data).getByteBuffAllocator();
1852      }
1853      return ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP;
1854    }
1855
1856    public BucketEntry writeToCache(final IOEngine ioEngine, final BucketAllocator alloc,
1857      final LongAdder realCacheSize, Function<BucketEntry, Recycler> createRecycler,
1858      ByteBuffer metaBuff) throws IOException {
1859      int len = data.getSerializedLength();
1860      // This cacheable thing can't be serialized
1861      if (len == 0) {
1862        return null;
1863      }
1864      if (isCachePersistent && data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1865        len += Long.BYTES; // we need to record the cache time for consistency check in case of
1866                           // recovery
1867      }
1868      long offset = alloc.allocateBlock(len);
1869      boolean succ = false;
1870      BucketEntry bucketEntry = null;
1871      try {
1872        int diskSizeWithHeader = (data instanceof HFileBlock)
1873          ? ((HFileBlock) data).getOnDiskSizeWithHeader()
1874          : data.getSerializedLength();
1875        bucketEntry = new BucketEntry(offset, len, diskSizeWithHeader, accessCounter, inMemory,
1876          createRecycler, getByteBuffAllocator());
1877        bucketEntry.setDeserializerReference(data.getDeserializer());
1878        if (data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1879          // If an instance of HFileBlock, save on some allocations.
1880          HFileBlock block = (HFileBlock) data;
1881          ByteBuff sliceBuf = block.getBufferReadOnly();
1882          block.getMetaData(metaBuff);
1883          // adds the cache time prior to the block and metadata part
1884          if (isCachePersistent) {
1885            ByteBuffer buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(Long.BYTES);
1886            buffer.putLong(bucketEntry.getCachedTime());
1887            buffer.rewind();
1888            ioEngine.write(buffer, offset);
1889            ioEngine.write(sliceBuf, (offset + Long.BYTES));
1890          } else {
1891            ioEngine.write(sliceBuf, offset);
1892          }
1893          ioEngine.write(metaBuff, offset + len - metaBuff.limit());
1894        } else {
1895          // Only used for testing.
1896          ByteBuffer bb = ByteBuffer.allocate(len);
1897          data.serialize(bb, true);
1898          ioEngine.write(bb, offset);
1899        }
1900        succ = true;
1901      } finally {
1902        if (!succ) {
1903          alloc.freeBlock(offset, len);
1904        }
1905      }
1906      realCacheSize.add(len);
1907      return bucketEntry;
1908    }
1909  }
1910
1911  /**
1912   * Only used in test
1913   */
1914  void stopWriterThreads() throws InterruptedException {
1915    for (WriterThread writerThread : writerThreads) {
1916      writerThread.disableWriter();
1917      writerThread.interrupt();
1918      writerThread.join();
1919    }
1920  }
1921
1922  @Override
1923  public Iterator<CachedBlock> iterator() {
1924    // Don't bother with ramcache since stuff is in here only a little while.
1925    final Iterator<Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>> i = this.backingMap.entrySet().iterator();
1926    return new Iterator<CachedBlock>() {
1927      private final long now = System.nanoTime();
1928
1929      @Override
1930      public boolean hasNext() {
1931        return i.hasNext();
1932      }
1933
1934      @Override
1935      public CachedBlock next() {
1936        final Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> e = i.next();
1937        return new CachedBlock() {
1938          @Override
1939          public String toString() {
1940            return BlockCacheUtil.toString(this, now);
1941          }
1942
1943          @Override
1944          public BlockPriority getBlockPriority() {
1945            return e.getValue().getPriority();
1946          }
1947
1948          @Override
1949          public BlockType getBlockType() {
1950            // Not held by BucketEntry. Could add it if wanted on BucketEntry creation.
1951            return null;
1952          }
1953
1954          @Override
1955          public long getOffset() {
1956            return e.getKey().getOffset();
1957          }
1958
1959          @Override
1960          public long getSize() {
1961            return e.getValue().getLength();
1962          }
1963
1964          @Override
1965          public long getCachedTime() {
1966            return e.getValue().getCachedTime();
1967          }
1968
1969          @Override
1970          public String getFilename() {
1971            return e.getKey().getHfileName();
1972          }
1973
1974          @Override
1975          public int compareTo(CachedBlock other) {
1976            int diff = this.getFilename().compareTo(other.getFilename());
1977            if (diff != 0) return diff;
1978
1979            diff = Long.compare(this.getOffset(), other.getOffset());
1980            if (diff != 0) return diff;
1981            if (other.getCachedTime() < 0 || this.getCachedTime() < 0) {
1982              throw new IllegalStateException(
1983                "" + this.getCachedTime() + ", " + other.getCachedTime());
1984            }
1985            return Long.compare(other.getCachedTime(), this.getCachedTime());
1986          }
1987
1988          @Override
1989          public int hashCode() {
1990            return e.getKey().hashCode();
1991          }
1992
1993          @Override
1994          public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1995            if (obj instanceof CachedBlock) {
1996              CachedBlock cb = (CachedBlock) obj;
1997              return compareTo(cb) == 0;
1998            } else {
1999              return false;
2000            }
2001          }
2002        };
2003      }
2004
2005      @Override
2006      public void remove() {
2007        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
2008      }
2009    };
2010  }
2011
2012  @Override
2013  public BlockCache[] getBlockCaches() {
2014    return null;
2015  }
2016
2017  public int getRpcRefCount(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
2018    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
2019    if (bucketEntry != null) {
2020      return bucketEntry.refCnt() - (bucketEntry.markedAsEvicted.get() ? 0 : 1);
2021    }
2022    return 0;
2023  }

2038    return singleFactor;

2052
2053  /**
2054   * Wrapped the delegate ConcurrentMap with maintaining its block's reference count.
2055   */
2056  static class RAMCache {
2057    /**
2058     * Defined the map as {@link ConcurrentHashMap} explicitly here, because in
2059     * {@link RAMCache#get(BlockCacheKey)} and
2060     * {@link RAMCache#putIfAbsent(BlockCacheKey, BucketCache.RAMQueueEntry)} , we need to guarantee
2061     * the atomicity of map#computeIfPresent(key, func) and map#putIfAbsent(key, func). Besides, the
2062     * func method can execute exactly once only when the key is present(or absent) and under the
2063     * lock context. Otherwise, the reference count of block will be messed up. Notice that the
2064     * {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap} can not guarantee that.
2065     */
2066    final ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, RAMQueueEntry> delegate = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
2067
2068    public boolean containsKey(BlockCacheKey key) {
2069      return delegate.containsKey(key);
2070    }
2071
2072    public RAMQueueEntry get(BlockCacheKey key) {
2073      return delegate.computeIfPresent(key, (k, re) -> {
2074        // It'll be referenced by RPC, so retain atomically here. if the get and retain is not
2075        // atomic, another thread may remove and release the block, when retaining in this thread we
2076        // may retain a block with refCnt=0 which is disallowed. (see HBASE-22422)
2077        re.getData().retain();
2078        return re;
2079      });
2080    }
2081
2082    /**
2083     * Return the previous associated value, or null if absent. It has the same meaning as
2084     * {@link ConcurrentMap#putIfAbsent(Object, Object)}
2085     */
2086    public RAMQueueEntry putIfAbsent(BlockCacheKey key, RAMQueueEntry entry) {
2087      AtomicBoolean absent = new AtomicBoolean(false);
2088      RAMQueueEntry re = delegate.computeIfAbsent(key, k -> {
2089        // The RAMCache reference to this entry, so reference count should be increment.
2090        entry.getData().retain();
2091        absent.set(true);
2092        return entry;
2093      });
2094      return absent.get() ? null : re;
2095    }
2096
2097    public boolean remove(BlockCacheKey key) {
2098      return remove(key, re -> {
2099      });
2100    }
2101
2102    /**
2103     * Defined an {@link Consumer} here, because once the removed entry release its reference count,
2104     * then it's ByteBuffers may be recycled and accessing it outside this method will be thrown an
2105     * exception. the consumer will access entry to remove before release its reference count.
2106     * Notice, don't change its reference count in the {@link Consumer}
2107     */
2108    public boolean remove(BlockCacheKey key, Consumer<RAMQueueEntry> action) {
2109      RAMQueueEntry previous = delegate.remove(key);
2110      action.accept(previous);
2111      if (previous != null) {
2112        previous.getData().release();
2113      }
2114      return previous != null;
2115    }
2116
2117    public boolean isEmpty() {
2118      return delegate.isEmpty();
2119    }
2120
2121    public void clear() {
2122      Iterator<Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, RAMQueueEntry>> it = delegate.entrySet().iterator();
2123      while (it.hasNext()) {
2124        RAMQueueEntry re = it.next().getValue();
2125        it.remove();
2126        re.getData().release();
2127      }
2128    }
2129
2130    public boolean hasBlocksForFile(String fileName) {
2131      return delegate.keySet().stream().filter(key -> key.getHfileName().equals(fileName))
2132        .findFirst().isPresent();
2133    }
2134  }
2135
2136  public Map<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> getBackingMap() {
2137    return backingMap;
2138  }
2139
2140  public AtomicBoolean getBackingMapValidated() {
2141    return backingMapValidated;
2142  }
2143
2144  @Override
2145  public Optional<Map<String, Pair<String, Long>>> getFullyCachedFiles() {
2146    return Optional.of(fullyCachedFiles);
2147  }
2148
2149  public static Optional<BucketCache> getBucketCacheFromCacheConfig(CacheConfig cacheConf) {
2150    if (cacheConf.getBlockCache().isPresent()) {
2151      BlockCache bc = cacheConf.getBlockCache().get();
2152      if (bc instanceof CombinedBlockCache) {
2153        BlockCache l2 = ((CombinedBlockCache) bc).getSecondLevelCache();
2154        if (l2 instanceof BucketCache) {
2155          return Optional.of((BucketCache) l2);
2156        }
2157      } else if (bc instanceof BucketCache) {
2158        return Optional.of((BucketCache) bc);
2159      }
2160    }
2161    return Optional.empty();
2162  }
2163
2164  @Override
2165  public void notifyFileCachingCompleted(Path fileName, int totalBlockCount, int dataBlockCount,
2166    long size) {
2167    // block eviction may be happening in the background as prefetch runs,
2168    // so we need to count all blocks for this file in the backing map under
2169    // a read lock for the block offset
2170    final List<ReentrantReadWriteLock> locks = new ArrayList<>();
2171    LOG.debug("Notifying caching completed for file {}, with total blocks {}, and data blocks {}",
2172      fileName, totalBlockCount, dataBlockCount);
2173    try {
2174      final MutableInt count = new MutableInt();
2175      LOG.debug("iterating over {} entries in the backing map", backingMap.size());
2176      Set<BlockCacheKey> result = getAllCacheKeysForFile(fileName.getName(), 0, Long.MAX_VALUE);
2177      if (result.isEmpty() && StoreFileInfo.isReference(fileName)) {
2178        result = getAllCacheKeysForFile(
2179          StoreFileInfo.getReferredToRegionAndFile(fileName.getName()).getSecond(), 0,
2180          Long.MAX_VALUE);
2181      }
2182      result.stream().forEach(entry -> {
2183        LOG.debug("found block for file {} in the backing map. Acquiring read lock for offset {}",
2184          fileName.getName(), entry.getOffset());
2185        ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = offsetLock.getLock(entry.getOffset());
2186        lock.readLock().lock();
2187        locks.add(lock);
2188        if (backingMap.containsKey(entry) && entry.getBlockType() == BlockType.DATA) {
2189          count.increment();
2190        }
2191      });
2192      int metaCount = totalBlockCount - dataBlockCount;
2193      // BucketCache would only have data blocks
2194      if (dataBlockCount == count.getValue()) {
2195        LOG.debug("File {} has now been fully cached.", fileName);
2196        fileCacheCompleted(fileName, size);
2197      } else {
2198        LOG.debug(
2199          "Prefetch executor completed for {}, but only {} data blocks were cached. "
2200            + "Total data blocks for file: {}. "
2201            + "Checking for blocks pending cache in cache writer queue.",
2202          fileName, count.getValue(), dataBlockCount);
2203        if (ramCache.hasBlocksForFile(fileName.getName())) {
2204          for (ReentrantReadWriteLock lock : locks) {
2205            lock.readLock().unlock();
2206          }
2207          locks.clear();
2208          LOG.debug("There are still blocks pending caching for file {}. Will sleep 100ms "
2209            + "and try the verification again.", fileName);
2210          Thread.sleep(100);
2211          notifyFileCachingCompleted(fileName, totalBlockCount, dataBlockCount, size);
2212        } else if (
2213          (getAllCacheKeysForFile(fileName.getName(), 0, Long.MAX_VALUE).size() - metaCount)
2214              == dataBlockCount
2215        ) {
2216          LOG.debug("We counted {} data blocks, expected was {}, there was no more pending in "
2217            + "the cache write queue but we now found that total cached blocks for file {} "
2218            + "is equal to data block count.", count, dataBlockCount, fileName.getName());
2219          fileCacheCompleted(fileName, size);
2220        } else {
2221          LOG.info("We found only {} data blocks cached from a total of {} for file {}, "
2222            + "but no blocks pending caching. Maybe cache is full or evictions "
2223            + "happened concurrently to cache prefetch.", count, dataBlockCount, fileName);
2224        }
2225      }
2226    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
2227      throw new RuntimeException(e);
2228    } finally {
2229      for (ReentrantReadWriteLock lock : locks) {
2230        lock.readLock().unlock();
2231      }
2232    }
2233  }
2234
2235  @Override
2236  public Optional<Boolean> blockFitsIntoTheCache(HFileBlock block) {
2237    long currentUsed = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
2238    boolean result = (currentUsed + block.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader()) < acceptableSize();
2239    return Optional.of(result);
2240  }
2241
2242  @Override
2243  public Optional<Boolean> shouldCacheFile(String fileName) {
2244    // if we don't have the file in fullyCachedFiles, we should cache it
2245    return Optional.of(!fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(fileName));
2246  }
2247
2248  @Override
2249  public Optional<Boolean> isAlreadyCached(BlockCacheKey key) {
2250    boolean foundKey = backingMap.containsKey(key);
2251    // if there's no entry for the key itself, we need to check if this key is for a reference,
2252    // and if so, look for a block from the referenced file using this getBlockForReference method.
2253    return Optional.of(foundKey ? true : getBlockForReference(key) != null);
2254  }
2255
2256  @Override
2257  public Optional<Integer> getBlockSize(BlockCacheKey key) {
2258    BucketEntry entry = backingMap.get(key);
2259    if (entry == null) {
2260      // the key might be for a reference tha we had found the block from the referenced file in
2261      // the cache when we first tried to cache it.
2262      entry = getBlockForReference(key);
2263      return entry == null ? Optional.empty() : Optional.of(entry.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader());
2264    } else {
2265      return Optional.of(entry.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader());
2266    }
2267
2268  }
2269}
